page.title: 11GUY FAWKES NIGHT IN OTTERY
page.content: 'Open Classes'. The procession is headed by effigy of Guy Fawkes and by the Carnival Queen and Princess'tableau. Brass Bands accompany the procession through the town. At 8pm a huge bonfire is lit by the River Otter and Guy Fawkes is burned. A few days before the carnival a fair arrives in the town and stays for approximately a week, people enjoy the dodgems, helter skelter, roundabouts and other amusements. During the evening the mens and ladies tar barrels are rolled or rather carried through the crowded streets. About a dozen men dressed in old clothes and wearing large thick padded gloves made from sacking meet at each pub in turn carrying the flaming barrel on shoulders until it disintegrates.
